qas.question: What is common in Romance languages?
What kind of derivation in Catalan is similar to other languages?
What word additive is usually added to verbs?
What other word changes can occur in derivations?
What word supplement  can be put on an already existing word base?

context: The process of <a1_0>morphological<a1_0/> derivation in Catalan follows the same principles as the other Romance languages, where <a0_0>agglutination<a0_0/> is common. Many times, several <a4_0>affixes<a4_0/> are appended to a preexisting lexeme, and some <a3_0>sound alternations<a3_0/> can occur, for example elèctric [əˈlɛktrik] ("electrical") vs. electricitat [ələktrisiˈtat]. <a2_0>Prefixes<a2_0/> are usually appended to verbs, for as in preveure ("foresee").
